title: Drawing, "Design for a Carved Mirror Frame", before 1742
medium: Black chalk; pen and black ink; brush and brown, rose and black watercolors on off-white laid paper; verso: graphite
provenance: From the collection of Leon decloux; in his collection in 1906
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Drawings of a high looking glass, a low mirror in an escutcheon. Verso: a scale

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Carved Mirror Frame", before 1742.
before 1742. Black chalk; pen and black ink; brush and brown, rose and black watercolors on off-white laid paper; verso: graphite. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-79.
